commit_message:
Switch Ubuntu to overlay2 docker driver

With 4.4 kernel we can use the improved overlay2 driver instead of
btrfs for significantly better performance when creating layers.

Change-Id: I0b84a2b34fdb71c07798d94b546d3105a2742321
Related-Id: I3b0dfd6db5298dfb34ec160eed910ca76feeb423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/19/413119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-get -y install --no-install-recommends docker-engine sudo apt-get -y install --no-install-recommends btrfs-tools setup_diskExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd --storage-driver overlay2

commit_message:
Add soft delete wrinkle to api-ref

The API reference for deleting a server is making the assumption that
the instance is going to be (hard) deleted from the system, but it
doesn't take into account the case that CONF.reclaim_instance_interval
is set, which if > 0 makes the API 'soft delete' the instance, so that
the instance's vm won't be deleted until the
CONF.reclaim_instance_interval has expired since the instance was soft
deleted. The instance marked as ``SOFT_DELETED`` can be recovered via
``restore`` action before it's really deleted from the system. We should
update the reference to talk about the soft deleted wrinkle so we can set
expectations.

Closes-Bug: #1650328

Change-Id: Ibbb1c225da11234aaac3634769db112a30dfef64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/411440/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: By default, the instance is going to be (hard) deleted immediately from the system, but you can set CONF.reclaim_instance_interval > 0 to make the API soft delete the instance, so that the instance's vm won't be deleted until the CONF.reclaim_instance_interval has expired since the instance was soft deleted. The instance marked as ``SOFT_DELETED`` can be recovered via ``restore`` action before it's really deleted from the system.

subject: [doc] Note lack of constraints is a choice
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 02:52:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tooz/commit/76fc50d94df214a639f9923fda1150ac7762fe70', 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove tooz.

commit_message:
Moving pyroute and oslo.privsep deps into requirements.txt

It is true that the code using the modules is still utilized in tests
only; but it's also true that those deps are now needed for example for
oslo-config-generator to work, so in the end, it's not only about tests.

Change-Id: I9e27aca32be03130057e00c727d29cb26532e860
Related-Bug: #1492714

subject: db: pick journal entry by seqnum
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 03:10:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/26e106e4aa5f1b297c3c832b5d8168fc14992fda', 'message': "db: pick journal entry by created_at + seqnum

db.get_oldest_pending_db_row_with_lock() should return oldest entry
regarding to created_at. not last_retried.
If last_retried is used, log entry is unnecessarily scanned when there
are dependencies. It's known that journal back log can be big like 1k
entries with tempest tests.
By using created_at + seqnum, it can be avoided because dependency is
basically the order of creation of journal entry.

example for details:
U0(processing), U1(pending), U2(pending), U3(pending) ...
-> time (created_at or last_retried)
where U<N> is update on same resource like neutron network.

When U1 is picked and put back to pending due to U0 dependency,
last_retried is updated. If last_retried is used to pick oldest entry,
it means U1 is put back at the last of the list.
So U2, U3 ... need to be picked/put back without any progress, then
U1 can be processed after U0 is completed. This behavior also imposes
too long latency.
The drawback is potential live lock. e.g. U1 can be picked and put back
repeatedly until U0 is completed. This will be addressed by the
following patch.

Change-Id: I67717e4cff67187a64eb6283a49ed5f0fe9b0d16
Closes-Bug: #1609609
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 23:48:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/f1d0f6c5db022524f9365b9703bb1dece34a0939', 'message': "db: pick journal entry by created_at + seqnum

"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-11 02:23:24.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/db/db.py', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/journal/test_dependency_validations.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/ccb673ef8a9c0259a7d2a4da9ec284a7bad819e6', 'message': "db: pick journal entry by seqnum

db.get_oldest_pending_db_row_with_lock() should return oldest entry
regarding to seqnum. not last_retried.
If last_retried is used, log entry is unnecessarily scanned when there
are dependencies. It's known that journal back log can be big like 1k
entries with tempest tests.
By using seqnum, it can be avoided because dependency is basically the
order of creation of journal entry.

example for details:
U0(processing), U1(pending), U2(pending), U3(pending) ...
-> time (seqnum or last_retried)
where U<N> is update on same resource like neutron network.

When U1 is picked and put back to pending due to U0 dependency,
last_retried is updated. If last_retried is used to pick oldest entry,
it means U1 is put back at the last of the list.
So U2, U3 ... need to be picked/put back without any progress, then
U1 can be processed after U0 is completed. This behavior also imposes
too long latency.
The drawback is potential live lock. e.g. U1 can be picked and put back
repeatedly until U0 is completed. This will be addressed by the
following patch.

Change-Id: I67717e4cff67187a64eb6283a49ed5f0fe9b0d16
Closes-Bug: #1609609
"}]
commit_message:
db: pick journal entry by seqnum

db.get_oldest_pending_db_row_with_lock() should return oldest entry
regarding to seqnum. not last_retried.
If last_retried is used, log entry is unnecessarily scanned when there
are dependencies. It's known that journal back log can be big like 1k
entries with tempest tests.
By using seqnum, it can be avoided because dependency is basically the
order of creation of journal entry.

example for details:
U0(processing), U1(pending), U2(pending), U3(pending) ...
-> time (seqnum or last_retried)
where U<N> is update on same resource like neutron network.

When U1 is picked and put back to pending due to U0 dependency,
last_retried is updated. If last_retried is used to pick oldest entry,
it means U1 is put back at the last of the list.
So U2, U3 ... need to be picked/put back without any progress, then
U1 can be processed after U0 is completed. This behavior also imposes
too long latency.
The drawback is potential live lock. e.g. U1 can be picked and put back
repeatedly until U0 is completed. This will be addressed by the
following patch.

Change-Id: I67717e4cff67187a64eb6283a49ed5f0fe9b0d16
Closes-Bug: #1609609

commit_message:
Switch to register RECOMMIT_ events for SG of V2 driver

Current V2 driver register AFTER_ event for SG/rules by default, now we
can switch it to PRECOMMIT_ event after patch in neutron side merged.

Change-Id: Iceabdedb694a12a490b6f750c5058d8ee6631e18
Depends-On: I451ae5f0c2157e8fcb34095d0745c3057a8fcfe8
Related-Bug: #1545667

commit_message:
linux/utils: fix error code match in i18n condition

Add new exception class CommandRunError to store error code,
instead of matching error code in string.

Signed-off-by: Duan Jiong <jduan@fiberhome.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] macvtap: Agent detects invalid migration

As of today, Macvtap agent allows invalid live migrations
from a host with interface mapping 'physnet1:eth1' to a host
with mapping 'physnet1:eth2'. Migration places the macvtap on
the target on 'eth2' instead of 'eth1'. This fix detects
such a migration in the agent. The agent then treats this
device like it has not been plugged.

Change-Id: Ie0184d4180d7a26bc4881f9dcd5f290fbd8ad7ac
Partial-Bug: #1550400i
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/03/293403/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron._i18n import _LE, _LI, _LW # When an instance is migrated from a source to a target host, libvirt # takes care about plugging the macvtap device. Now if the # physical_interface_mapping on the source host is a different one # than on this target host, libvirt tries to configure the macvtap on # the wrong interface (the one from the source). If this interface does # not exist on the target, nova fails plugging the vif and migration # fails. But if that interface does exist on the target host, but is # used for another physnet or not used at all by OpenStack, libvirt # plugging succeeds. This code ensures, that in such a case migration # will fail and the instance remains active on the source site. expected_if = self.interface_mappings[ network_segment.physical_network] if network_segment.network_type == p_constants.TYPE_VLAN: expected_if = macvtap_common.get_vlan_device_name( expected_if, network_segment.segmentation_id) macvtap_dev = ip_lib.IPDevice(self.mac_device_name_mappings[device]) actual_if = macvtap_dev.link.parent_interface_name if expected_if != actual_if: LOG.warning(_LW("Macvtap %(macvtap)s device was created as " "subinterface of %(actual)s, but should have been " "created as subinterface of %(expected)s! This " "can occur during live migration, if the source " "host uses another pyhsical_interface_mapping on " "this target host. To enable Live Migration, " "setup your nodes with the same " "macvtap.physcial_interface_mappings! Setting " "link down, to prohibit network communication " "into the wrong physical network!"), {'macvtap': device, 'actual': actual_if, 'expected': expected_if}) macvtap_dev.link.set_down() return False macvtap_dev.link.set_allmulticast_on()

commit_message:
Add linux interface OPTS

This patch brings over neutron.agent.linux.interface.OPTS as
part of our base agent effort [1]. A number of consumers import
interface just to get at OPTS, so rehoming them to lib  reduces
the dependency chain.

Note that an equivalent of opts.py will be brought
over in a separate patch.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron_lib_base_agent

Change-Id: Ia4d0a47c0c167b8b875b55bb522ae124153371db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/30/318930/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
add verification when narrowing allocation pool

1.problem
Now there are no verifications about narrowing allocation pool of subnet,
so there are some vms which have the ips in a subnet,
the ip of vm belong to the allocation pool of the subnet.
when we narrowed the range of allocation pool to ignore the ips of vm,
Now the operation can succeed
2.solution
The ipaddress of vm in ipallocation must belong to a ipallocationpools
when narrowing the range of allocation pool
we get the ipallocation from db
verify the allocation poll with the vm ips
if not ,raise IPAllocationNotInAllocationPools

Change-Id: Ie4a0fa45a388f4a7515134af8903bbfd7536a25b
Closes-Bug: #1634330

commit_message:
WIP: Run pylint on skipped tempest test

As per Barcelona summit fishbowl testing session, we're gonna introduce
a set of tests that cannot be run on the gate but still will be part of
the tree.

These tests will live in a specific directory. As these days we don't
run pylint on neutorn/tests directory this patch introduces a
whitelist of directories/files that will be specifically checked.
Skipped tests will be part of this whitelist.

Change-Id: I5c5571142d29938f0bfe659f74de5626bfa267e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/46/392146/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set of files divided by a space that will be explicitly checked by pylint WHITELIST_FILES='neutron/tests/tempest/scenario/skipped' pylint --rcfile=.pylintrc --output-format=colorized ${files} $WHITELIST_FILES

commit_message:
linux/utils: fix error code match in i18n condition

Add new exception class CommandRunError to store error code,
instead of matching error code in string.

Change-Id: I3b71a65b511233323fec8b979ad853bc4c9fb23e
Signed-off-by: Duan Jiong <jduan@fiberhome.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] fullstack: test dvr router functionality

Fullstack tests for east west traffic, snat and
floatingip with dvr router.

note: Temporarily disabled IPv6 tests to debug fullstack
test failures

Partial-Bug: #1583028
Change-Id: I106165b6e5afb98698a4d83088435c0a1467195a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/07/318307/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _test_east_west_traffic(self, dvr=False): tenant_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() router = self.safe_client.create_router(tenant_id, dvr=dvr) vm1 = self._create_net_subnet_and_vm( tenant_id, '20.0.0.0/24', self.environment.hosts[0], router)[2] vm2 = self._create_net_subnet_and_vm( tenant_id, '21.0.0.0/24', self.environment.hosts[1], router)[2] # wait until qr-xx port up in qrouter-xx namespace vm1.block_until_ping(vm2.ip) def _test_snat_and_floatingip(self, dvr=False): tenant_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() public = self._create_public_network(tenant_id) router = self.safe_client.create_router(tenant_id, dvr=dvr, external_network=public['id']) vm = self._create_net_subnet_and_vm( tenant_id, '20.0.0.0/24', self.environment.hosts[1], router)[2] # Wait until qr-xx and qg-xx ports up in qrouter-xx namespace. # ping central-external-br vm.block_until_ping(self.external_gateway_ip) self.safe_client.create_floatingip( tenant_id, public['id'], vm.ip, vm.neutron_port['id']) # ping central-external-br vm.block_until_ping(self.external_gateway_ip) self._test_east_west_traffic() self._test_snat_and_floatingip() class TestDVRL3Agent(TestL3Agent): def setUp(self): host_descriptions = [ environment.HostDescription( l3_agent=True, dvr_agent_mode='dvr_snat'), environment.HostDescription(l3_agent=True, dvr_agent_mode='dvr')] env = environment.Environment( environment.EnvironmentDescription( network_type='vxlan', l2_pop=True, dvr=True), host_descriptions) super(TestDVRL3Agent, self).setUp(env) def test_east_west_traffic(self): self._test_east_west_traffic(dvr=True) def test_snat_and_floatingip(self): self._test_snat_and_floatingip(dvr=True)
deleted_lines: tenant_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() router = self.safe_client.create_router(tenant_id) vm1 = self._create_net_subnet_and_vm( tenant_id, '20.0.0.0/24', self.environment.hosts[0], router)[2] vm2 = self._create_net_subnet_and_vm( tenant_id, '21.0.0.0/24', self.environment.hosts[1], router)[2] # wait until qr-xx port up in qrouter-xx namespace vm1.block_until_ping(vm2.ip) tenant_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() public = self._create_public_network(tenant_id) router = self.safe_client.create_router(tenant_id, external_network=public['id']) vm = self._create_net_subnet_and_vm( tenant_id, '20.0.0.0/24', self.environment.hosts[1], router)[2] # Wait until qr-xx and qg-xx ports up in qrouter-xx namespace. # ping central-external-br vm.block_until_ping(self.external_gateway_ip) self.safe_client.create_floatingip( tenant_id, public['id'], vm.ip, vm.neutron_port['id']) # ping central-external-br vm.block_until_ping(self.external_gateway_ip)

commit_message:
Added fullstack tests for MTU-sized frame inter-connectivity

This test set includes both same network inter-connectivity tests as
well as through using a router. TODO: add east-west without FIP
involved.

This is an attempt to reproduce the bug programmatically.

Required creating a new constant for ICMP header length
and moving the IP one to the common file.

Change-Id: I2eb674e4353b87d2b3665c14571a78777ae2950d
Related-Bug: #1622017
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/70/369470/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _test_connectivity_mtu(self): tenant_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() network = self.safe_client.create_network(tenant_uuid) self.safe_client.create_subnet( tenant_uuid, network['id'], '20.0.0.0/24') vms = [ self.useFixture( machine.FakeFullstackMachine( self.environment.hosts[i], network['id'], tenant_uuid, self.safe_client)) for i in range(3)] for vm in vms: vm.block_until_boot() vms[0].block_until_ping(vms[1].ip, size=network['mtu']) vms[0].block_until_ping(vms[2].ip, size=network['mtu']) vms[1].block_until_ping(vms[2].ip, size=network['mtu']) def test_connectivity_mtu(self): self._test_connectivity_mtu() def test_connectivity_mtu(self): self._test_connectivity_mtu()

added_lines: def profiled(fun): from eventlet.green import profile def inner(*args, **kwargs): prof = profile.Profile() prof.runcall(fun, *args, **kwargs) file_name = './%s.profile' % fun.__name__ prof.dump_stats(file_name) return inner @profiled

commit_message:
Fix filename of openstack-quantum-xen-plugins.spec

The build-rpm.sh script uses openstack-neutron-xen-plugins
as plugin name. Because of that the correct filename is
openstack-neutron-xen-plugins.spec.

Change-Id: Id48bae8232c933840d6732c23888ff367023e6d2

commit_message:
Remove test case that exist in Tempest repo

The test case test_dhcp_stateful_fixedips_outrange already exists
in tempest repo, So neutron needs to drop this test case.

Change-Id: Ib6a929f114d0456c4a0d7c21684ddd5f003d7103
Closes-Bug: 1605121
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/71/345271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import netaddr from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc from tempest import test @test.idempotent_id('98244d88-d990-4570-91d4-6b25d70d08af') def test_dhcp_stateful_fixedips_outrange(self): """When port gets IP address from fixed IP range it shall be checked if it's from subnets range. """ kwargs = {'ipv6_ra_mode': 'dhcpv6-stateful', 'ipv6_address_mode': 'dhcpv6-stateful'} subnet = self.create_subnet(self.network, **kwargs) ip_range = netaddr.IPRange(subnet["allocation_pools"][0]["start"], subnet["allocation_pools"][0]["end"]) for i in range(1, 3): ip = netaddr.IPAddress(ip_range.last + i).format() self.assertRaises(lib_exc.BadRequest, self.create_port, self.network, fixed_ips=[{'subnet_id': subnet['id'], 'ip_address': ip}])

To be able to run functiona tests on any host (even non-linux) you
can install Vagrant, VirtualBox and ansible. Then you have to
launch a Linux VM running missing services (MySQL and PosgreSQL):

vagrant up functional

Finally you can run your functional tests from your host system:

tox -e functional

Change-Id: I05a72e4b5e203ede129c58728b1aa90d2e3a29c3
'}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2016-11-10 21:54:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/f698e28da174bcc91d43cd28e1e27688da744a51', 'message': 'WIP: Add Vagrant script to run functional tests.

To be able to run functiona tests on any host (even non-linux) you
can install Vagrant, VirtualBox and ansible. Then you have to
launch a Linux VM running missing services (MySQL and PosgreSQL):

vagrant up functional

Finally you can run your functional tests from your host system:

commit_message:
WIP: Add Vagrant script to run functional tests.

To be able to run functiona tests on any host (even non-linux) you
can install Vagrant, VirtualBox and ansible. Then you have to
launch a Linux VM running missing services (MySQL and PosgreSQL):

vagrant up sql

Finally you can run your functional tests from your host system:

tox -e functional

To create a VM running ODL

vagrant up odl

Change-Id: I05a72e4b5e203ede129c58728b1aa90d2e3a29c3

commit_message:
[PoC] Using Netlink to delete conntrack entries

Currently FWaaS and SG are using conntrack-tools to delete conntrack
entries. However, calling large number of conntrack-commands costs
time and system resources.
This patch proposes using Netlink to delete conntrack entries. There
is a similar approach with FWaaS[1] with full performance tests[2] and
unit tests as well. These same things will be added to this Neutron
patch as soon as possible.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389654/
[2]https://goo.gl/3tm9Fx

Change-Id: Ic8ff7db45e0034a10138a8a3a41d9e7674fea586
Co-Authored-By: Cao Xuan Hoang <hoangcx@vn.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/17/396117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_conntrack_rules(self, rules, devices): """ :param rules: Input rules change :param devices: Input device change :return: list of conntrack rules, each conntrack rule is a tuple which contains information about (ethertype, protocol, src_address, dst_address, zone) ex: [('ipv4', 'tcp', '10.0.0.0.1/32', '10.0.0.0/24', 1)] """ keys = ['ethertype', 'protocol', 'source_ip_prefix', 'dest_ip_prefix', 'zone'] conntrack_rules = [] for rule in rules: conntrack_rule = [None for i in range(len(keys))] ethertype = rule.get(keys[0]) direction = rule.get('direction') conntrack_rule[0] = str(ethertype).lower() conntrack_rule[1] = rule.get(keys[1]) if direction == 'egress': conntrack_rule[3] = netaddr.IPNetwork(rule.get(keys[3])) else: conntrack_rule[2] = netaddr.IPNetwork(rule.get(keys[2])) for device in devices: conntrack_rule[4] = self.get_device_zone(device['device']) ips = device.get('fixed_ips', []) for ip in ips: net = netaddr.IPNetwork(ip) if str(net.version) not in ethertype: continue if direction == 'egress': conntrack_rule[2] = netaddr.IPNetwork(ip) else: conntrack_rule[3] = netaddr.IPNetwork(ip) conntrack_rules.append(tuple(conntrack_rule)) return conntrack_rules
deleted_lines: from neutron._i18n import _LE @staticmethod def _generate_conntrack_cmd_by_rule(rule, namespace): ethertype = rule.get('ethertype') protocol = rule.get('protocol') direction = rule.get('direction') cmd = ['conntrack', '-D'] if protocol: cmd.extend(['-p', str(protocol)]) cmd.extend(['-f', str(ethertype).lower()]) cmd.append('-d' if direction == 'ingress' else '-s') cmd_ns = [] if namespace: cmd_ns.extend(['ip', 'netns', 'exec', namespace]) cmd_ns.extend(cmd) return cmd_ns def _get_conntrack_cmds(self, device_info_list, rule, remote_ip=None): conntrack_cmds = set() cmd = self._generate_conntrack_cmd_by_rule(rule, self.namespace) ethertype = rule.get('ethertype') for device_info in device_info_list: zone_id = self.get_device_zone(device_info['device']) ips = device_info.get('fixed_ips', []) for ip in ips: net = netaddr.IPNetwork(ip) if str(net.version) not in ethertype: continue ip_cmd = [str(net.ip), '-w', zone_id] if remote_ip and str( netaddr.IPNetwork(remote_ip).version) in ethertype: if rule.get('direction') == 'ingress': direction = '-s' else: direction = '-d' ip_cmd.extend([direction, str(remote_ip)]) conntrack_cmds.add(tuple(cmd + ip_cmd)) return conntrack_cmds def _delete_conntrack_state(self, device_info_list, rule, remote_ip=None): conntrack_cmds = self._get_conntrack_cmds(device_info_list, rule, remote_ip) for cmd in conntrack_cmds: try: self.execute(list(cmd), run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=True, extra_ok_codes=[1]) except RuntimeError: LOG.exception( _LE("Failed execute conntrack command %s"), cmd) def delete_conntrack_state_by_rule(self, device_info_list, rule): self._delete_conntrack_state(device_info_list, rule) def delete_conntrack_state_by_remote_ips(self, device_info_list, ethertype, remote_ips): for direction in ['ingress', 'egress']: rule = {'ethertype': str(ethertype).lower(), 'direction': direction} if remote_ips: for remote_ip in remote_ips: self._delete_conntrack_state( device_info_list, rule, remote_ip) else: self._delete_conntrack_state(device_info_list, rule)

commit_message:
Use GIT_BASE from tox.

To speadup git-clone operation DevStack accepts GIT_BASE variable
to allow use a local git mirror and save time. This patch enable
using it also from inside tox with the purpose of speeding up
functional tests execution.

Change-Id: I290b1a70e6952f6c6645e32be6097f994b347f98

commit_message:
Tenant_id is visible in neutron *.list commands

Partial-Bug: 1250766

Adds the tenant_id tag in __init__.py
Edit in all list classes corresponding to
neutron list command
(list_columns=neutronV20.ListCommand.list_columns
+ [tags of that lists])

Change-Id: I0066e6b473dbf5e9c742cd4eacdb908ae663ef66

commit_message:
Use "binding:*" constants defined in extensions.portbinding

The constants HOST_ID, PROFILE, VNIC_TYPE, VIF_TYPE, VIF_DETAILS
are defined in extensions.portbindings, we should use them
instead of hardcoded strings.

Change-Id: Ie59d58a2feb336f4e4d8852cf131f067deeb03ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/55/397255/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.extensions import portbindings port['port'][portbindings.HOST_ID] = 'host' port['port'][portbindings.HOST_ID] = 'host' port['port'][portbindings.HOST_ID] = 'host' port['port'][portbindings.HOST_ID] = 'host'

commit_message:
Revert "Reset RNG seed with current time and pid for each test started"

The original patch was based on a hypothesis that fullstack test
failures are caused by random number collisions.  The hypothesis
turned out to be false and the default random seeding code of
python is better.

Change-Id: Idd79b84c291666930d54c78d6e846ad80b30a27b
Related-bug: #1551288
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/78/298578/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Neutron address-groups

This change adds the common code to handle new address-groups API:

* API extension
* Service plugin
* DB model
* DB migration
* OVO support
* Unittests

It also introduce an optional attribute for the security-group-rule, the
'remote-address-group', a uuid field to refer a specific address-group
object, to be used instead of the current 'remote-ip-prefix' that can
only denote one IP network.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-address-groups

Change-Id: Idc343425283b5b0ce63796eb98d641034d34acce

commit_message:
DONOTMERGE: Test ovn-controller which doesn't create chassis rec

Instead the devstack/lib/networking-ovn script will create the
chassis record. The ovn mech driver will now set the chassis
id in the "Logical_Switch_Port.options:chassis".
ovn-northd will set the Port_Binding.chassis column.

Change-Id: Ie8588a425f470bc351e2b7e4443be32a901eb99a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/38/383638/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVN_REPO=${OVN_REPO:-https://github.com/numansiddique/ovs.git}OVN_BRANCH=${OVN_BRANCH:-no_chassis_rec_creation} # Create the Chassis record in OVN SB DB for chassis hname=$(hostname -f) ovn-sbctl --db=$OVN_SB_REMOTE chassis-add $OVN_UUID geneve,vxlan $HOST_IP $hname iface_types=$(ovs-vsctl get Open_vSwitch . iface_types) datapath_type=$(ovs-vsctl get Bridge br-int datapath-type) ovn-sbctl --db=$OVN_SB_REMOTE set Chassis $OVN_UUID external-ids:iface-types="$iface_types" ovn-sbctl --db=$OVN_SB_REMOTE set Chassis $OVN_UUID external-ids:datapath-type="$datapath_type" ovn-sbctl --db=$OVN_SB_REMOTE set Chassis $OVN_UUID external-ids:ovn-bridge-mappings=${PHYSICAL_NETWORK}:${OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE}

commit_message:
Prevent unsupported implementation for IPv6 address

As per [1] , there are certain combinations of IPv6 RA mode
and IPv6 Address mode which have not been implemented.
Until they are not , it does not seem useful to support them.
This patch tries to fix that, until the implementation of the
combinations is not complete.

[1] : http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/networking-guide/config-ipv6.html#ipv6-ra-mode-and-ipv6-address-mode-combinations

Change-Id: I1d59e51cf09d8ae3bc61aaa4b7d27ec2625ff45a
Closes-Bug: #1622624

Please " "consider other options.") raise exc.InvalidInput(error_message=msg)

commit_message:
Fix neutron-client can repeat (set/clear) gateway in router

Currently neutron-client allows user to repeatedly update the
gateway to same ip address. It also allows user to clear the
gateway for a router which does not have any gateway associated
to it.
This patch adds a check in set-gateway,if update same gateway info
for a router,should display command error message.
This patch adds a check in clear-gateway,if router does not have
any gateway associated to it,should display command error message

Change-Id: Ifea1a984aeb8335c8f715799f0222c8dec13a8a1
Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee <reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>
Closes-Bug: #1422371

commit_message:
SIGUSR1 is deprecated in Guru mediation

Guru mediation now registers SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 by default for
backward compatibility. SIGUSR1 will no longer be registered in
a future release, so please use SIGUSR2 to generate reports[1].

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.reports/usage.html
Closes-Bug: #1528758

Change-Id: I41c2edd7f86db6a5cd2922298b2643baab5f7c71

commit_message:
Change passing session to context in segments db functions

We have a number of functions that expect to get session as one
the arguments. Passing session is not correct and this prevents
of usage new enginefacade which expect context to be passed and
session will be injected in current context.

Change-Id: I31a851f28cdb9dee6066e3030470dbeb6a1ae436
Depends-On: I68ac442f11a6698bc43210fae877ba3809b1c02d

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 04:21:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/efda5e8f9fd40013b7eae1fd56ade91b67e32bb4', 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.utils.

Change-Id: I612b881da465c96ee8200118f8f2b90ef2f02225
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-13 04:40:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/5ed08659fbe8491dbf31c05976c64968ee387c98', 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.utils.

Change-Id: I612b881da465c96ee8200118f8f2b90ef2f02225

subject: Add -w option for iptables call when attempt to get traffic counters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 14:15:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ef5f593f9b4113df51528bbdb2b1b6553521e123', 'message': "Add -w option for iptables call when attempt to get traffic counters

iptables_manager trying to get traffic counter with executing iptables command.
May happen that during this call an another process can hold the xtables lock
and that's why iptables_manager may produce a lot of errors in a logs.
Adding -w option can prevent this errors and make to wait for the xtables lock.
Also related unit tests was changed.

Change-Id: I6d8b48dc1083acde89749f17b922a2287721304a
Closes-bug: #1528868
"}]
commit_message:
Add -w option for iptables call when attempt to get traffic counters

iptables_manager trying to get traffic counter with executing iptables command.
May happen that during this call an another process can hold the xtables lock
and that's why iptables_manager may produce a lot of errors in a logs.
Adding -w option can prevent this errors and make to wait for the xtables lock.
Also related unit tests was changed.

Change-Id: I6d8b48dc1083acde89749f17b922a2287721304a
Closes-bug: #1528868

commit_message:
Remove duplicate role assignment in federated setup

Our federated test cases have their own dedicated testing setup that
goes through and creates everything, including domains, projects,
roles, groups, role assignments, etc...

There was a duplicated role assignment that looks like it was missed
in a refactor. This commit removes the duplicated role assignment.

Change-Id: I93cdb2e58d83ff98dd40e54d91e520b5ef606b3a

commit_message:
Normalize group sections

The current implementation doesn't distinguish between different
cases for the group sections. As result, some options are grouped in
different places or even duplicate their values. This change
normalize the group sections to lower case with the exception of
DEFAULT group.

Change-Id: Ia6bced383d36977005e2bf4532bdca9e9d4fe515
Closes-Bug: #1646084

commit_message:
Split OVN northd and ml2 plugin

This allows us to take advantage of the composable roles hiera
settings to connect the plugin to the northd/ovndb API without
needing to hard-code the IP of the node running the service.

Change-Id: I2508d48f81c1819ae3521fff271c0bdc50724604
Depends-On: I9af7bd837c340c3df016fc7ad4238b2941ba7a95
Closes-Bug: #1634171

commit_message:
Add nova-status upgrade check command framework

This adds the basic framework for the nova-status
upgrade check commands. Follow up patches will flesh
this out to perform cells v2 and placement API related
upgrade status checks.

A man page is added for the new CLI and as part of that
the man page index is sorted.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction
Part of blueprint resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters

Change-Id: I687dd7317703a1bb76c197ebba849ca368c0872e

subject: Make workers ORM compatible with SQLAlchemy 1.1.4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 15:13:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/91d31618c212fc8d1422a3c548832e51f482d67e', 'message': "Make workers ORM compatible with SQLAlchemy 1.1.4

We don't currently support SQLAlchemy 1.1.4, but in preparation of the
day we do we can start making simple changes that will facilitate the
transition.

In SQLAlchemy 1.1 the .autoincrement directive is no longer implicitly
enabled for a composite primary key column, so the id field in the
workers ORM class will no longer be set as autoincrement, which means
that when creating a worker we will not be updating the id field of the
instance and it will left as None in memory while it is properly set in
the DB.

This patch resolves this issue by defining the id field as an auto
increment field explicitly instead of relying on the implicit definition
exiting in SQLAlchemy 1.0.

Closes-bug: #1651448
Change-Id: I570a4f0ea7850478097a735631031c75f0a65c5a
"}]
commit_message:
Make workers ORM compatible with SQLAlchemy 1.1.4

We don't currently support SQLAlchemy 1.1.4, but in preparation of the
day we do we can start making simple changes that will facilitate the
transition.

In SQLAlchemy 1.1 the .autoincrement directive is no longer implicitly
enabled for a composite primary key column, so the id field in the
workers ORM class will no longer be set as autoincrement, which means
that when creating a worker we will not be updating the id field of the
instance and it will left as None in memory while it is properly set in
the DB.

This patch resolves this issue by defining the id field as an auto
increment field explicitly instead of relying on the implicit definition
exiting in SQLAlchemy 1.0.

Closes-bug: #1651448
Change-Id: I570a4f0ea7850478097a735631031c75f0a65c5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/32/413132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, autoincrement=True)

commit_message:
Add description of additional attributes for nodes, bonds, NICs

Add the desctription to the Fuel plugin SDK guide

Change-Id: I573ffd6f91d37b534cf1db88910833ac71279751
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/54/413554/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _plugin-attributes: Additional attributes for NICs, bonds, and nodes ------------------------------------------------ You can provide additional attributes for NICs, bonds, and nodes. This is useful for a plugin providing "per interface" or "per node" technology. An example of this use case is virtual functions support for vRouter on each network interface in Contrail. **To provide additional attributes for NICs:** Edit the ``nic_attributes.yaml`` file with the additional attributes. **Example:** .. code-block:: yaml attribute_a: label: "NIC attribute A" description: "Your description" type: "text" value: "" attribute_b: label: "NIC attribute B" description: "Your description" type: "checkbox" value: false **To provide additional attributes for bonds:** Edit the ``bond_attributes.yaml`` file with the additional attributes. **Example:** .. code-block:: yaml attribute_a: label: "Bond attribute A" description: "Your description" type: "text" value: "" attribute_b: label: "Bond attribute B" description: "Your description" type: "checkbox" value: false **To provide additional attributes for nodes:** Edit the ``node_attributes.yaml`` file with the additional attributes. **Example:** .. code-block:: yaml plugin_section_a: metadata: group: "your_new_section" label: "Section A" attribute_a: label: "Node attribute A for section A" description: "Your description" type: "text" attribute_b: label: "Node attribute B for section A" description: "Your description" type: "checkbox"

revisions:

This updates the documentation to set the sync_power_state_interval
to a large number instead of -1. Using -1 results in the error

ValueError: Periodicity/spacing must be greater than zero instead of -1

Change-Id: I1eb95345f8746a6ac7b97352bdeb20ca33e9434c
'}]
commit_message:
Update dev-quickstart: interval value cannot be -1

This updates the documentation to set the sync_power_state_interval
to a large number instead of -1. Using -1 results in the error

ValueError: Periodicity/spacing must be greater than zero instead of -1

-1 used to work until we started using the futurist/periodics code.

Change-Id: I1eb95345f8746a6ac7b97352bdeb20ca33e9434c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/44/414244/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # change the periodic sync_power_state_interval to a week, to avoid getting NodeLocked exceptions sed -i "s/#sync_power_state_interval = 60/sync_power_state_interval = 604800/" etc/ironic/ironic.conf.local
deleted_lines: # turn off the periodic sync_power_state task, to avoid getting NodeLocked exceptions sed -i "s/#sync_power_state_interval = 60/sync_power_state_interval = -1/" etc/ironic/ironic.conf.local

Add memcached_servers for keystone authtoken

keystone_authtoken.

commit_message:
Fix for validating firewall resource status

In case of firewall resource, Stack creation is not waiting for
resource status and returning as stack COMPLETE status.
Following fix validate for create complete.

Change-Id: I71bd16b3a5c851e16ddc9cd963be73501cdced8d
Closes-Bug: 1648059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/64/408064/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import cfg def test_create_failed_error_status(self): cfg.CONF.set_override('action_retry_limit', 0, enforce_type=True) rsrc = self.create_firewall() neutronclient.Client.show_firewall('5678').AndReturn( {'firewall': {'status': 'PENDING_CREATE'}}) neutronclient.Client.show_firewall('5678').AndReturn( {'firewall': {'status': 'ERROR'}}) self.m.ReplayAll() error = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)) self.assertEqual( 'ResourceInError: resources.firewall: ' 'Went to status ERROR due to "Error in Firewall"', six.text_type(error)) self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.FAILED), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll()

subject: Delete port created by kuryr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 06:32:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/18749a8a42a7bd71f8664eabe7fcebe3174d0516', 'message': "Delete port in existing neutron network

In current code, we get the port's subnet by checking the subnet's
subnetpool_id equal with the given PoolID, but in existing environment,
subent maybe lack of the subnetpool_id, hence we will not get the port's
subnet and leaves the port undeleted.

This patch(a workaround) checks the subnet, if subnet's network is a
existing one, and the subnet's subnetpool_id is None or equal to the
given PoolID, we will delete the subnet. If we delete the port which
not belongs to the subnet mets an exception, we need to pass.

Change-Id: I736adbb2409b50a5e11d3aa7d31778944cfdeae1
Co-Authored-By: Liping Mao <limao@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1651015
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 06:36:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/29d487b160fade2435016abe6a1c5d7542f7bba6', 'message': "[WIP] Delete port in existing neutron network

In current code, we get the port's subnet by checking the subnet's
subnetpool_id equal with the given PoolID, but in existing environment,
subent maybe lack of the subnetpool_id, hence we will not get the port's
subnet and leaves the port undeleted.

This patch(a workaround) checks the subnet, if subnet's network is a
existing one, and the subnet's subnetpool_id is None or equal to the
given PoolID, we will delete the subnet. If we delete the port which
not belongs to the subnet mets an exception, we need to pass.

Change-Id: I736adbb2409b50a5e11d3aa7d31778944cfdeae1
Co-Authored-By: Liping Mao <limao@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1651015
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-20 11:29:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/a746e7a094ad44b28b99e5ef966b2ae1dd1ebf70', 'message': "Delete port created by kuryr

In current code, we get the port's subnet by checking the subnet's
subnetpool_id equal with the given PoolID, but in existing environment,
subent maybe lack of the subnetpool_id, hence we will not get the port's
subnet and leaves the port undeleted.

This patch checks the port's device owner and determine the give POOL's
subnet_id and ip_address is equal to port's fixed_ips attribute.

Change-Id: I736adbb2409b50a5e11d3aa7d31778944cfdeae1
Co-Authored-By: Liping Mao <limao@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1651015
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-21 05:47:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/commit/d5e11a0e067efb84e06d1836d371cf83f0def4fb', 'message': "Delete port created by kuryr

In current code, we get the port's subnet by checking the subnet's
subnetpool_id equal with the given PoolID, but in existing environment,
subent maybe lack of the subnetpool_id, hence we will not get the port's
subnet and leaves the port undeleted.

commit_message:
Delete port created by kuryr

In current code, we get the port's subnet by checking the
subnet's subnetpool_id equal with the given PoolID, but in
existing environment, the subnet may lack subnetpool_id,
hence we will not get the port's subnet and leaves the
kuryr-libnetwork port undeleted.

This patch checks the port's device owner and determines
the given POOL's subnet_id and ip_address is equal to
port's fixed_ips attribute.

Change-Id: I736adbb2409b50a5e11d3aa7d31778944cfdeae1
Co-Authored-By: Liping Mao <limao@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1651015

added_lines: iface = ipaddress.ip_interface(six.text_type(rel_address)) network = _get_networks_by_attrs(id=tmp_subnet['network_id']) # See if the network is pre-existed if network and network[0]['tags']: for tag in network[0]['tags']: if tag == const.KURYR_EXISTING_NEUTRON_NET: if (tmp_subnet['subnetpool_id'] is None or tmp_subnet['subnetpool_id'] == pool_id): rcvd_fixed_ips = [] fixed_ip = {'subnet_id': tmp_subnet['id']} fixed_ip['ip_address'] = six.text_type(iface.ip) rcvd_fixed_ips.append(fixed_ip) try: filtered_ports = [] all_ports = app.neutron.list_ports() for port in all_ports['ports']: if port['fixed_ips'] == rcvd_fixed_ips: filtered_ports.append(port) for port in filtered_ports: app.neutron.delete_port(port['id']) except n_exceptions.NeutronClientException as ex: app.logger.warning(_LW("Error happened while " "fetching and deleting " "port, %s"), ex) # Pass if the port not belongs the subnet. pass return flask.jsonify(const.SCHEMA['SUCCESS'])

commit_message:
nova-status: check for cells v2 upgrade readiness

This adds the nova-status upgrade readiness check for cells v2
which is very similar to the 030 API DB schema migration except
we only check the cell and host mappings, we don't rely on flavors
being in the database or not. Since this check requires that you
run 'nova-manage cell_v2 simple_cell_setup' first, or a manual
variant thereof, we really only care about the cells v2 parts.

Part of blueprint cells-scheduling-interaction

Change-Id: Id52c0b7373585286292d252236bfbba13e13fc69

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1dffb6bce2dbe4d52819a9fa2162f80b7e806525

commit_message:
Add a generic failure message on exception

This adds a message similar to the one logged on success, but with
details relevant to failed installs.  It prints the exception
message and leaves a pointer to the install log.  If undercloud_debug
is enabled, it also re-raises the exception so the full traceback
can be seen.

Change-Id: I3c5d65000dd5d053e94a65e10ef941a5c312ab7c

commit_message:
Add basic structure for ReNo

ReNo [1] is the release management tool in OpenStack.

This patch adds the basic structure to start using it for doc
builds in puppet-tripleo.

* Update .gitignore
* Add a basic note "use-reno"
* Add releasenotes/ dir and basic files
* Add python files: setup.cfg, setup.py, test-requirements.txt and
  tox.ini.

  [1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno

Change-Id: Idc9a30ab632c8e2ca794fb10431cdefd5d861d14

commit_message:
Manage disallow_iframe_embed

disallow_iframe_embed can be used to prevent Horizon from being
embedded within an iframe. Legacy browsers are still vulnerable
to a Cross-Frame Scripting (XFS) vulnerability, so this option
allows extra security hardening where iframes are not used in
deployment

Change-Id: I2fe6b243250608b340ee555062060dbdad1a49c4
Depends-On: I5c540e552efe738bdec8598f9257fa22ae651a76
Closes-Bug: #1641882

commit_message:
Amend response details for custom resource classes PUT

The code in I99e7bcfe27938e5e4d50ac3005690ac1255d4c5e actually
returns the updated resource class from the PUT operation and
the response code is 200, not 204 with an empty body.

Change-Id: Ieb7a7f72f9c43886028fdaeac7a790baaea74716
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/22/406322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The response body will contain the resource class details and the response code will be a `200 OK` upon successful name change. Example:: 200 OK Content-Type: application/json { "name": "CUSTOM_BAREMETAL_SILVER", "links": [ { "rel": "self", "href": "/resource_classes/CUSTOM_BAREMETAL_SILVER" } ] }
deleted_lines: The response body is empty and the response code will be a `204 No Content` upon successful name change.

subject: Add network_config_hook interface to run-os-net-config.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 21:58:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/cc0104286e062f87fdd7f8f2816f3b6fafeb341f', 'message': "Add network_config_hook interface to run-os-net-config.sh

run-os-net-config.sh only allows for limited customization of the
network configuration in config.json. Namely, it only customizes the
bridge_name and interface_name.

This will likely not be sufficient for all use cases. This patch adds a
generic network_config_hook bash function that will be called if it is
defined. The function is an entry point for deployers to write custom
code to further influence run-os-net-config.sh.

A possible alternative approach would be to pass the server resource
into the NetworkConfig template. That would allow running arbitrary
SoftwareDeployments on the server before NetworkDeployment is executed.
However, the interface of NetworkDeployment is likely still not as
flexible as this approach as the inputs are hardcoded in the role
template files (role.role.j2.yaml), which are not meant to be modified
by deployers.

The immediate use case for this work is using os-net-config in our
multinode CI jobs where we need to create vxlan tunnels between the
nodes and we need to know the local private IP of each node for the
tunnel endpoint. As the IP is different for each node, it's not a
parameter we could specify in the templates.

Change-Id: I26d0ebdaba6fcd3fe885e41ed234eb79a2405228
Implements: blueprint multinode-os-net-config

commit_message:
Add network_config_hook interface to run-os-net-config.sh

run-os-net-config.sh only allows for limited customization of the
network configuration in config.json. Namely, it only customizes the
bridge_name and interface_name.

This will likely not be sufficient for all use cases. This patch adds a
generic network_config_hook bash function that will be called if it is
defined. The function is an entry point for deployers to write custom
code to further influence run-os-net-config.sh.

A possible alternative approach would be to pass the server resource
into the NetworkConfig template. That would allow running arbitrary
SoftwareDeployments on the server before NetworkDeployment is executed.
However, the interface of NetworkDeployment is likely still not as
flexible as this approach as the inputs are hardcoded in the role
template files (role.role.j2.yaml), which are not meant to be modified
by deployers.

The immediate use case for this work is using os-net-config in our
multinode CI jobs where we need to create vxlan tunnels between the
nodes and we need to know the local private IP of each node for the
tunnel endpoint. As the IP is different for each node, it's not a
parameter we could specify in the templates.

Change-Id: I26d0ebdaba6fcd3fe885e41ed234eb79a2405228
Implements: blueprint multinode-ci-os-net-config

added_lines: if [ $(type -t network_config_hook) = "function" ]; then network_config_hook fi

commit_message:
Remove unused variables from federation tests

A test method in test_v3_federation.py didn't do anything with the
output it received because it was expecting the call to return a
failure status code, which is check with `expected_status`. This
commit just removes the unused variables since they aren't
asserting anything about the test behavior.

Change-Id: I5eb374f8504a2818384d2631f905dc323d548f60

subject: Update global progress if no progress was sent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 14:06:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/6b1559ec6eb3c7e81cb8cdc3450bdaf9d0ec05a6', 'message': 'Update global progress if no progress was sent

At now moment Astute do not send global progress
for transaction/deploy tasks. Nailgun should
calculate it using nodes progress.

commit_message:
Update global progress if no progress was sent

At now moment Astute do not send global progress
for transaction/deploy tasks. Nailgun should
calculate it using nodes progress.

This fix add ability to calculate progress in case
of transaction same way as for deploy.

Change-Id: I2c87b0de0bacb83ef98ff230f8ad0d5f7904becd
Closes-Bug: #1645612

commit_message:
VMAX driver - MVs and SGs not reflecting correct protocol.

Masking views and storage groups names in VMAX3 are not
reflecting correct protocol. This will result in naming
conflict if someone is using both FC and iscsi protocols
in the same environment.

Change-Id: I361857115906e21b91ee4d4e943fa841f6e44ba0
Closes-Bug: #1640222

as part of the subnets list appears to have a significant
impact when the network has tags and the subnets have
extra routes entries. This is even further compounded by
the network having rbac entries (likely due to the subnet
inheriting the RBAC entries of the network with the custom
join condition in the model).

This patch converts rbac_entries on both subnet and network
to use a subquery and converts the network and subnets
relationships on the subnet and network models (respectively)
to use subqueries as well.

On my dev environment after running the script in the report,
a network list took 5 minutes. Converting just the rbac_entries
or just the network/subnet relationship to subqueries reduced it
to 3-5 seconds. Converting both (as this patch does), reduces it
back down to a couple of hundred milliseconds (normal perf of my
development env with the current network count).

Subqueries will just cost us a constant number of queries and
won't scale up with result count so this should not impact scalability
in any way.

None of these fields are queryable from the API, so we don't need
to worry about breaking queries against the models.

Partial-Bug: #1649317
Change-Id: Ic1947e3d78d58a79b21344b10cb7ab0e573e419f
(cherry picked from commit a802b382d331423bf3449665dcfa7c48d7b8e094)
"}]
commit_message:
Use subqueries for rbac_entries and subnets<->network

Loading subnets as part of the networks list and networks
as part of the subnets list appears to have a significant
impact when the network has tags and the subnets have
extra routes entries. This is even further compounded by
the network having rbac entries (likely due to the subnet
inheriting the RBAC entries of the network with the custom
join condition in the model).

This patch converts rbac_entries on both subnet and network
to use a subquery and converts the network and subnets
relationships on the subnet and network models (respectively)
to use subqueries as well.

On my dev environment after running the script in the report,
a network list took 5 minutes. Converting just the rbac_entries
or just the network/subnet relationship to subqueries reduced it
to 3-5 seconds. Converting both (as this patch does), reduces it
back down to a couple of hundred milliseconds (normal perf of my
development env with the current network count).

Subqueries will just cost us a constant number of queries and
won't scale up with result count so this should not impact scalability
in any way.

None of these fields are queryable from the API, so we don't need
to worry about breaking queries against the models.

Partial-Bug: #1649317
Change-Id: Ic1947e3d78d58a79b21344b10cb7ab0e573e419f
(cherry picked from commit a802b382d331423bf3449665dcfa7c48d7b8e094)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/79/413979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rbac_db_models.NetworkRBAC, lazy='subquery', uselist=True, Subnet, backref=orm.backref('networks', lazy='subquery'), lazy="subquery") backref='network', lazy='subquery',
deleted_lines: rbac_db_models.NetworkRBAC, lazy='joined', uselist=True, Subnet, backref=orm.backref('networks', lazy='joined'), lazy="joined") backref='network', lazy='joined',

subject: Improve os_transport_url ssl support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 12:47:19.000000000', 'files': ['spec/functions/os_transport_url_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/parser/functions/os_transport_url.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/f11f604159f05f617e267d122b03c1731274147a', 'message': 'Improve os_transport_url ssl support

The ssl paramter of the os_transport_url should be 0/1 but we do not
ensure that this is the value being used in the creation of the
transport_url. This change leverages the stdlib str2bool and bool2num to
ensure that when provided the ssl paramter ends up being 0/1 which is
the correct format for the transport url.  Additionally this also allows
for string booleans to be passed into the ssl parameter and it should
still work correctly.

Change-Id: I278559ba98ba48974ae590dc1e0bb99b6ab961d7
(cherry picked from commit cbeb29e69badd079b4c9c8b723b8097255f88e56)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve os_transport_url ssl support

The ssl paramter of the os_transport_url should be 0/1 but we do not
ensure that this is the value being used in the creation of the
transport_url. This change leverages the stdlib str2bool and bool2num to
ensure that when provided the ssl paramter ends up being 0/1 which is
the correct format for the transport url.  Additionally this also allows
for string booleans to be passed into the ssl parameter and it should
still work correctly.

Change-Id: I278559ba98ba48974ae590dc1e0bb99b6ab961d7
(cherry picked from commit cbeb29e69badd079b4c9c8b723b8097255f88e56)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib refs/changes/08/413608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ssl can be passed in as a query paramter but should be 0/1. See # http://docs.celeryproject.org/projects/kombu/en/latest/userguide/connections.html#urls # so we rely on the stdlib str2bool and bool2num to ensure it's in the # format ssl_val = function_bool2num([function_str2bool([v['ssl']])]) v['query'].merge!({ 'ssl' => ssl_val }) v['query'] = { 'ssl' => ssl_val }

commit_message:
Add resource_properties_data data migration

Prepare for the future when both resources and events refer to
properties data in this table, rather than storing duplicate copies.

Change-Id: Idb7ed0ddd76d2780993a677114f8e10ccce56862
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/00/361900/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ResourcePropertiesData(BASE, HeatBase): """Represents resource properties data, current or older""" __tablename__ = 'resource_properties_data' id = sqlalchemy.Column(sqlalchemy.Integer, primary_key=True) data = sqlalchemy.Column('data', types.Json) encrypted = sqlalchemy.Column('encrypted', sqlalchemy.Boolean) rsrc_prop_data_id = sqlalchemy.Column(sqlalchemy.Integer, sqlalchemy.ForeignKey( 'resource_properties_data.id')) rsrc_prop_data = relationship(ResourcePropertiesData, backref=backref('event')) rsrc_prop_data_id = sqlalchemy.Column(sqlalchemy.Integer, sqlalchemy.ForeignKey( 'resource_properties_data.id')) rsrc_prop_data = relationship(ResourcePropertiesData, backref=backref('resource'))

commit_message:
One transaction per encrypt/decrypt batch

Previously, there was one (potentially quite large) transaction across
all batches of templates and resources when encrypting/decrypting
parameters and properties data via the rpc api.

Change-Id: Iba10b7c9e88a1ae3d94ab9ddf4a8e362e72c0d50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/90/362290/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

while next_batch: with session.begin(subtransactions=True): for raw_template in next_batch: try: if verbose: LOG.info(_LI("Processing raw_template %(id)d..."), {'id': raw_template.id}) env = raw_template.environment needs_update = False # using "in env.keys()" so an exception is raised # if env is something werid like a string. if env is None or 'parameters' not in env.keys(): if param_schemata = tmpl.param_schemata() if not param_schemata: continue for param_name, param_val in \ env['parameters'].items(): if (param_name in encrypted_params or param_name not in param_schemata or not param_schemata[param_name].hidden): continue encrypted_val = crypt.encrypt( six.text_type(param_val), encryption_key) env['parameters'][param_name] = encrypted_val encrypted_params.append(param_name) needs_update = True if needs_update: environment = env.copy() environment['encrypted_param_names'] = \ encrypted_params else: # decrypt for param_name in encrypted_params: method, value = env['parameters'][param_name] decrypted_val = crypt.decrypt(method, value, encryption_key) env['parameters'][param_name] = decrypted_val needs_update = True if LOG.exception(_LE('Failed to %(crypt_action)s parameters ' 'of raw template %(id)d'), {'id': raw_template.id, 'crypt_action': crypt_action}) excs.append(exc) continue finally: if verbose: commit_message:
Change _get_pci_dev_list func

Add hostname check and run lshw only on bootstrap nodes.
Add sanitize param to lshw to hide any ip,mac etc

Change-Id: I7739da68ab059178787ff0fe2418a54717684750
Closes-Bug: #1554970
(cherry picked from commit 1dd3dd64bff80dd60c53881adc9c378fd6660bf6)

commit_message:
Support oslo.i18n in mistralclient

Adding the _i18n.py file to use oslo.i18n libraries in mistral.
Also updating the requirements to support i18n.

Change-Id: I2d842c0203f37259e2e1ec7b9bb654e8c5efd283

commit_message:
Backup/restore cinder/nova to ssh

This patch implements ability to backup/restore
to remote ssh host

freezer-agent --storage ssh --ssh-key <pub_key> --ssh-username <user>
--ssh-host <host> --container <path-to-remote-backup> --mode cinder
--cinder-vol-id <cinder-id>

freezer-agent --action restore --storage ssh --ssh-key <pub_key>
--ssh-username <user> --ssh-host <host> --container
<path-to-remote-backup> --mode cinder --cinder-vol-id <cinder-id>

Change-Id: If79c3473646e32bcda14a83db53fe95479fffff4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/95/411895/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CHUNK_SIZE = 32768 type = 'ssh' ssh.load_system_host_keys() # paramiko SFTPClient.listdir_attr returns # directories in arbitarary order, so we should # sort results of this command res = self.ftp.listdir(directory) return sorted(res) def read_remote_file(self, path): file_stats = self.ftp.stat(path) file_size = file_stats.st_size data = "" received_size = 0 with self.open(path, 'r') as reader: reader.prefetch(file_size) while True: chunk = reader.read(CHUNK_SIZE) if len(chunk) == 0: break received_size += len(chunk) data += chunk if file_size != received_size: raise IOError('Size mismatch: expected {} received {}'.format( file_size, received_size)) return data

commit_message:
Stop adding ServiceAvailable group option

Service available group already exists. Therefore there is no
need to register this group again.

Change-Id: I5abc17fd748d1afda507a6ba36dea2d765ee4d84
Closes-Bug: #1621036

potentially security sensitive constructs.

commit_message:
Introduce Hitachi VSP iSCSI driver

This patch introduces Hitachi VSP iSCSI driver.

Signed-off-by: "Kazumasa Nomura <kazumasa.nomura.rx@hitachi.com>"

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint hitachi-vsp-fc-driver

Change-Id: I65d38f88201d55315eb3bfbffb2a72aa88a91a0d
Depends-on: Ife99bf138c86a2f9be91298064513073271f1239
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/00/398300/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2016, Hitachi, Ltd.VERSION = '1.0.0' if self.storage_info['protocol'] == 'iSCSI': self.check_param_iscsi() def check_param_iscsi(self): """Check iSCSI-related parameter values and consistency among them.""" if self.conf.vsp_use_chap_auth: if not self.conf.vsp_auth_user: msg = utils.output_log(601, param='vsp_auth_user') raise exception.HBSDError(data=msg) if not self.conf.vsp_auth_password: msg = utils.output_log(601, param='vsp_auth_password') raise exception.HBSDError(data=msg) targets = kwargs.pop('targets', {'info': {}, 'list': [], 'iqns': {}}) """Create a host group or an iSCSI target on the storage port.""" target_name, gid = self.create_target_to_storage(port, connector, hba_ids) def create_target_to_storage(self, port, connector, hba_ids): """Create a host group or an iSCSI target on the specified port.""" """Configure the target to meet the environment.""" """Delete the host group or the iSCSI target from the port.""" 'iqns': {}, elif self.storage_info['protocol'] == 'iSCSI': data = self.get_properties_iscsi(targets, multipath) else: target_luns = [] for target in targets['list']: if targets['lun'][target[0]]: target_luns.append(target_lun) data['target_luns'] = target_luns def get_properties_iscsi(self, targets, multipath): """Return iSCSI-specific server-LDEV connection info.""" data = {} primary_target = targets['list'][0] if not multipath: data['target_portal'] = self.storage_info[ 'portals'][primary_target[0]] data['target_iqn'] = targets['iqns'][primary_target] else: data['target_portals'] = [ self.storage_info['portals'][target[0]] for target in targets['list'] if targets['lun'][target[0]]] data['target_iqns'] = [ targets['iqns'][target] for target in targets['list'] if targets['lun'][target[0]]] if self.conf.vsp_use_chap_auth: data['auth_method'] = 'CHAP' data['auth_username'] = self.conf.vsp_auth_user data['auth_password'] = self.conf.vsp_auth_password return data 'iqns': {}, if self.storage_info['protocol'] == 'FC': target_wwn = [ self.storage_info['wwns'][port_gid[:utils.PORT_ID_LENGTH]] for port_gid in unmap_targets['list']] return {'driver_volume_type': self.driver_info['volume_type'], 'data': {'target_wwn': target_wwn}}
deleted_lines: # Copyright (C) 2014, 2016, Hitachi, Ltd.VERSION = '1.2.0' 1.1.0 - Add manage_existing/manage_existing_get_size/unmanage methods. 1.2.0 - Refactor the driver. 'iqns': {}, targets = kwargs.pop('targets', {'info': {}, 'list': []}) """Create a host group for the specified storage port.""" target_name, gid = self.create_target_to_storage(port, connector) def create_target_to_storage(self, port, connector): """Create a host group on the specified port.""" """Configure the host group to meet the environment.""" """Delete the host group from the port.""" target_wwn = [ self.storage_info['wwns'][port_gid[:utils.PORT_ID_LENGTH]] for port_gid in unmap_targets['list']] return {'driver_volume_type': self.driver_info['volume_type'], 'data': {'target_wwn': target_wwn}}

commit_message:
Stop adding ServiceAvailable group option

This commit modifies the tempest plugin to avoid keep adding
already existing option groups.

Change-Id: I5768f907beb2458487e05a3fa5a51e6d7182dbe6
Closes-Bug: #1621036

commit_message:
Changed the output format of stack-snapshot

The stack-snapshot gives an output in the json format. This is
not consistent with the other usecases of heat which give output
in tabular form. hence, changed the output format of
stack-snapshot to tabular form.

Change-Id: I168d3afcffa420ac6d753a82e84eda9db363d834

commit_message:
Replace MagicMock with Mock class

MagicMock magically allow things to pass. Any usage should be
replaced with the Mock class and explicit attributes should
be set on it.

Change-Id: If62e3f68698527756879471bde0139bb6bef9360
Closes-Bug: #1475722

commit_message:
Changed the GIT_BASE to https://git.openstack.org

The git://git.openstack.org base url does not work on most of the
systems. Hence changed the base url to https and mentioned the
other as alternate url.

Change-Id: I656737dbe39fba86fd4ea96f942685f701b31814
Closes-Bug: #1625442

commit_message:
Removed the --request-format argument as it is deprecated

The --request-parameter has been deprecated and json is set to
default. So, this patch removes the --request-format argument
from the HELP.

Change-Id: Id59af0f82e85c389001582b7a97189e7b9c3a996
Closes-Bug: #1582706
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/07/318707/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: '--request-format', help=_('DEPRECATED! Only JSON request format is supported.'), default='json', choices=['json', ], ) parser.add_argument( choices=['json', ],

commit_message:
Hide the deprecated options from the help message

The --key-file
    --ca-file
and --cert-file options have been deprecated. So, this patch
hides these options from the optional arguments of the help
message.

Change-Id: I19c4885f144104f25240c1a860163af03d0d58b2
Closes-Bug: #1583923
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/04/319104/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Changed LOG.warn to LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It still used in a few places. This updates
those one to use the non-deprecated LOG.warning instead.

commit_message:
Added port.update.end support for attaching new port

When attaching new port to an existing VM, designate code catches
"port.update.end" to add dns name when a new port is attached to
existing instance.

Change-Id: I6152efd0bded8fdc7e2f05de34588e001ffca1e1
Closes-Bug: #1501392
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/71/309971/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import netaddr elif event_type == 'port.update.end': '''TODO: Add name to payload''' LOG.debug('TODO: Add name to payload') payload['hostname'] = '' version = "" for data in payload['port']['fixed_ips']: if "." in data['ip_address']: version = 4 elif ":" in data['ip_address']: version = 6 ip_address = hex(netaddr.IPAddress(data['ip_address'])) ip_address = str(ip_address)[2:] data['ip_address'] = ':'.join(ip_address[i:i + 4] for i in range(0, len(ip_address),4)) data['version'] = version payload['instance_id'] = payload['port']['device_id'] payload['tenant_id'] = payload['port']['tenant_id'] self._create(payload['port']['fixed_ips'], payload, resource_id=payload['instance_id'], resource_type='instance')

Removed the --no-ssl-compression parameter which is deprecated

removed from the help message.

commit_message:
Updated the incorrect document

While creating secondary zones , email is set to some default
value. But, the document says that email and ttl are null for
secondary type. So, made both the fields required.

Change-Id: Ib546576883cc505cfb2622f5f34df7fbc4a53f4b
Closes-Bug: #1507965
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/38/321538/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :form email: email address, required for both PRIMARY and SECONDARY types. :form ttl: time-to-live numeric value in seconds, required for both PRIMARY and SECONDARY types.
deleted_lines: :form email: email address, required for type PRIMARY, NULL for SECONDARY. :form ttl: time-to-live numeric value in seconds, NULL for SECONDARY

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual (partial fix)

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).
This patch includes a few of the files changed to ease the review.
The other files will be committed in the coming patches.

Change-Id: Ib155e5720cc7dcd0adadc0e0000a7e6aef1ba9bc
Partial-Bug: #1259292

Changed the $real_service_name to $service_name

in ec2api for consistency.

default for forward compatbility.

commit_message:
Added the options to be configured for designate-central service

This patch adds workers, threads, storage-driver,
enabled-notification-handlers options to the central.pp as these
options have to be configured for designate-central.

Change-Id: Iac7b7090c595b7321c6ac063e6635c1a8b256371
Closes-Bug: #1539327
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/50/379950/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Changed package name python-swauth to swauth

In debian repo and ubuntu repo, the last version of package is
"swauth" and not python-swauth. So, changed package name
python-swauth to swauth.

Change-Id: I98cda62d0c0e83d900efa3171b6b92a85213ad4f
Closes-Bug: #1625625

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,B) provided by
testtools.

Change-Id: Ie8afb48bd344268eba31eddd6e7e51546c58f38e
Closes-bug: #1268480

rather than root.

commit_message:
Replace local storage of domain UUIDs with leader storage

Currently the Keystone leader charm creates new domains and stores
the UUIDs locally on disk. This approach predates charm relation-/
leader- storage, is error prone, and causes problems in HA setups.

Move to leader storage and remove old interfaces. There is no need
to migrate the on-disk stored data as it is read from the deployment
and stored as a part of the upgrade process.

Do not set default values for service_tenant_id, admin_domain_id and
default_domain_id. This will cause context to be incomplete on peer
units until the values are actually available.

Change functional tests to run on Keystone cluster to verify contents of
configuration and operation of services in clustered environment.

(also fixup stable amulet tests to use python from venv).

Closes-Bug: 1637453
Change-Id: Id0eaf7bfceead627cc691e9b52dd889d60c05fa9
(cherry picked from commit 4d2ab6668f8601a17bbda1bf89ab7633f22d8d3d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone refs/changes/22/410822/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: leader_get, ctxt['admin_domain_id'] = \ leader_get(attribute='admin_domain_id') ctxt['default_domain_id'] = \ leader_get(attribute='default_domain_id')
deleted_lines: get_admin_domain_id, get_default_domain_id ctxt['admin_domain_id'] = ( get_admin_domain_id() or 'admin_domain_id') # default is the default for default_domain_id ctxt['default_domain_id'] = ( get_default_domain_id() or 'default')

commit_message:
Revert "Fix `openstack  cluster profile validate` bug"

Like I21fe5dad0b401672fdde719b8d0adff5fef1e54d, this relies on features
from the SDK has not been released/integrated with upper-constraints.txt

This reverts commit 82771162c96f6ce82aa7deefcb3f2112f553b420.

Change-Id: Idf4be216ffb7ecb2632489754c830b9357f8173d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 12:47:19.000000000', 'files': ['spec/functions/os_transport_url_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/parser/functions/os_transport_url.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/commit/e66c3c0a587792082d410ce8c6715e452ce9c314', 'message': 'Fix os_transport_url with single hosts array

If an array with a single host is passed into the hosts param, the
function was erroring because the host was getting converted to a string
when it was checking for bracketing for ipv6. This change checks the
type and fixes the case where a single host is being passed so it
continues to function.

Change-Id: I91b9959a6f71b4e6885e55a568116cc28cf16ddd
Closes-Bug: #1650042
(cherry picked from commit 8d37c059d23434ca1f249aef5ffd5d07220e49fc)

commit_message:
Fix os_transport_url with single hosts array

If an array with a single host is passed into the hosts param, the
function was erroring because the host was getting converted to a string
when it was checking for bracketing for ipv6. This change checks the
type and fixes the case where a single host is being passed so it
continues to function.

Change-Id: I91b9959a6f71b4e6885e55a568116cc28cf16ddd
Closes-Bug: #1650042
(cherry picked from commit 8d37c059d23434ca1f249aef5ffd5d07220e49fc)

commit_message:
Spawn a thread to call _do_container_run

This method block the zun-compute process to serve other requests,
so run it in a thread

Change-Id: I96f7add17956e9c46c32335c08c247996c1d49a8

commit_message:
EMC VMAX: Remove unused is_in_range() method

This method is not used.  It is also not
compatible with Python 3.

Closes-Bug: #1648113

Change-Id: If5c762ef7bd893311274d497439f21bbcff7e45f

commit_message:
Cleanup plugin links upon a cluster reset

Currently plugin links survive cluster reset and there is no way to get
rid of them. Cluster reset seems like a reasonable place to get rid of
them.

Change-Id: Id88c54b34a162881c6662ee1acb6090d4fee3fae
Closes-Bug: #1578700
(cherry picked from commit 8e73412a2df49cd42beb5c4601c6802d91a6a278)

commit_message:
Replace MagicMock with Mock

MagicMock mocks all magic methods without any need
which allows errorneous things to pass whereas Mock
doesn't do so and let's you to mock methods as per
use. So this patch replaces MagicMock with Mock in
files at location zun/tests/unit/common.

Change-Id: I8781363dae13395ca15a1b58970616b682f40247
Partial-Bug: #1475722

  to 'security_groups' in data migration
* names of appropriate functions were also changed

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-saharaclient.

Change-Id: Ie448db6f78865a3dddadf7dc659c7546a5e0fa72
(cherry picked from commit fb803225f3e7c48958acc86a9e9b747d598320ee)

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-saharaclient.

Change-Id: Ie448db6f78865a3dddadf7dc659c7546a5e0fa72
(cherry picked from commit fb803225f3e7c48958acc86a9e9b747d598320ee)

commit_message:
Adding tenant_id to regex_search

In order to allow the creation of clusters templates and node group
templates with the same across projects, even when set to public, we need to
filter only from the requester's project when creating a new resources.
This will narrow the name check to same project only.

Change-Id: Icc39c7e680c2fff583069a5522b2a11afb3e239b
Closes-bug: #1584680

commit_message:
Update "Additional Details for MapReduce jobs" docs

Currently, the documentation present in edp.rst refers only to the
properties mapred.mapper.class and mapred.reducer.class, these
(mapred properties) are deprecated in version 2.7.1.

Change-Id: I7b845e2a4f72b93931ba5475110a490178474666
Closes-Bug: 1650690
